content:
As a Ph.D. student at the Department of Marketing at Tilburg University (since September 2019), I empirically investigate the market for digital music and streaming services under the supervision of Hannes Datta and George Knox. In my first essay, I assess how artists’ adoption of streaming services (i.e., the fact that artists start releasing music on Spotify) affects subsequent music production.
I hold a Research Master’s Degree in Quantitative Marketing from Tilburg University (2019), and a B.A. in Economics from Koç University (2018).
summary: As a Ph.D. student at the Department of Marketing at Tilburg University (since September 2019), I empirically investigate the market for digital music and streaming services under the supervision of Hannes Datta and George Knox.
title: Nazlı M. Alagöz

content:
On Field experiments   Why Economists Should Conduct Field Experiments and 14 Tips for Pulling One Off - John A. List  On searching for instrumental variables:   Instrumental Variables and the Search for Identification: From Supply and Demand to Natural Experiments  Job market & PhD process    How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Job Market - Eric Zwick
   The 12 Step Program for Grad School - Eric Zwick
   How to Learn to Stop Worrying and Love the Job Market Sarah Jacobson
  Other Guides   A Graph is Worth a Thousand Citations - Eric Zwick  Book Suggestions   Lean Startup - Eric Ries Treat your PhD process like a startup and decrease frustrations
  Algorithms to Live By - Brian Christian and Tom Griffiths Effective methods to apply when making decisions and trying to achieve something I especially found Chapters 2 (Explore/Exploit: The Latest vs. Greatest) and 7 (Overfitting: When to Think Less) useful, especially for PhD process and your 20s.
  Thinking in Bets - Annie Duke Along the same lines as the book above.
  Scrum: The Art of Doing Twice the Work in Half the Time Book by J. J. Sutherland Make your work visible, keep track of things and avoid frustrations
  Deep Learning for Coders with Fastai and PyTorch - Jeremy Howard and Sylvain Gugger Accessible guide to Machine Learning with Python. They also have a related web lectures here. After you get the basics with this book and Andrew Ng’s coursera course you can check out ML for economics here.
  The Road from Coorain - Jill Ker Conway
  Behave - Robert Sapolsky A biological perspective on human behavior and emotions
  The Selfish Gene - Richard Dawkins
  Favorite Podcasts  How I Built This with Guy Raz The Daily NPR Short Wave NPR Fresh Air Radiolab DIY Musician Podcast Spotify: A Product Story Switched on POP  Usuful Stuff for Your Live in the Netherlands  News: NOS.nl, NLtimes Twitter accounts of 24/7 BZ, RIVM Apps: Buienradar, Reisapp (only in Dutch), Picnic (for groceries), DigiD, ThuisBezorgd, 9292, NS, Meetup, Classpass (gym classes platform)
summary: On Field experiments   Why Economists Should Conduct Field Experiments and 14 Tips for Pulling One Off - John A. List  On searching for instrumental variables:   Instrumental Variables and the Search for Identification: From Supply and Demand to Natural Experiments  Job market & PhD process    How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Job Market - Eric Zwick
